author: badtemperedpeanut
body: I would like to see OPs DD on this as I have different ideas. To get a general idea it might be good to compare Fastly with Akamai and see how it fits. Akamai is the leader in the space with revenue of $3B+ and have the market cap of $15B. Fastly have market cap of $8B with revenue of $200m. They are not creating any new market, they are just trying to get the market share from Akamai and others. After a few years a lot of that market is going away to AWS Cloudfront anyway. My 2C.

author: pakiprophet
body:
Akamai? Good buy? Will it grow ?
May be not as much as cloudflare.

author: bombsfalldown
body:
Cloudflare has way more competitors than just AWS: ddos-guard, akamai, fastly, etc.

I also think you're underestimating how big AWS actually is, a long with what AWS actually does.

author: Hotpocketsand
body:
AKAM has finally reached February lows!  

Lets all give it a hand!

author: aurelius94
body:
Was keen until must recent earnings. New customer acquisition was dreadful.

NET and even AKAM have served me better, NET is my favourite in CDN.

author: haraami_shakaal
body:
AKAM. 
Still one of the most undervalued highly profitable companies in the cloud/CDN/web security domain.

author: cdhollan
body: AKAM is the industry leader and I think their growth rates were single digit. Too low for what I was looking for

author: cdhollan
body: I looked at Akamai back when I chose to go with NET and FSLY. I haven’t looked at it recently since I already had made my decision and entered positions. I can see if I have my old comparison though. It was back in Q2/Q3 tho.

author: WilhelmSuperhitler
body:
I am down 20% on PSTH, but I am keeping it because it's a bet that Ackman will buy something good with that money. I still haven't changed my mind.

But I sold Akamai within a couple of months for what I bought if for because I couldn't remember why I bought it in the first place..
